oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wedding photograph published in newspaper, of Mr. and Mrs. James Collins Thurman, Jr., 1933 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A scrapbook page about the wedding of Miss Kathryn Parrish, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William McMurray Parrish, to James Collins Thurman (Mr. and Mrs. James Collins Thurman, Jr.). This was published in the local Chattanooga? newspaper, stating “Couple leaves on wedding trip and plans to return home in Fairyland: The wedding of Miss Kathryn Shaw Parrish, of Nashville, and James Collins Thurman, Jr., took place yesterday morning at 11 o’clock at eh Episcopal Church of the Advent in Nashville, with the rector, Dr. Prentice A. Pugh, officiating. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William McMurray Parrish, and is the sister of Miss Polly Parrish, of Nashville. She has visited in Chattanooga a number of times with her grandfather, Clark A. Shaw, former manager of the Chicago Civic Opera company. She is the niece of K. de G. McVitty, American consul for Capetown, South Africa. The bride was educated at Ward-Belmont college, where she received a certificate in dancing. She has also studied dancing under Ruth S. Denis and Paul Mathis, formerly of the Denishawn school, and during the past season has been head of the dancing department of the McLaughlin studios. She is a member of the Theta Phi sorority and of the Nashville Girls’ Cotillion club. Mr. Thurman is a son of Mr. and Mrs. J. C. Thurman and is the brother of Miss Josephine Thurman and William Clifford Thurman. He is a graduate of McCallie school, attended Vanderbilt university and is a member of Phi Delta fraternity. He is connected with the Pure Ice company. The bride’s gown was of roseseed crepe, trimmed with white organza, and worn with a hat of embroidered white organza and white accessories. She carried a white prayerbook with a chatelaine of lillies of the valley. Mr. Thurman and his bride, after a wedding trip, will reside in Fairyland on Lookout mountain. Chattanoogans attending the wedding were Mr. and Mrs. Claude Givens, Miss Jane Givens, Miss Josephine Thurman, William Clifford Thurman and Mrs. Charles S. Gwin.” Forms part of the James C. Thurman Collection. 1 scrapbook page ; b & w.
